+     "dev": "concurrently \"npm run dev:lead-dashboard\" \"npm run dev:roi-calculator\" \"npm run dev:website\"",
+     "dev:lead-dashboard": "cd apps/lead-dashboard && npm run dev",
+     "dev:roi-calculator": "cd apps/roi-calculator && npm run dev", 
+     "dev:website": "cd apps/website && npm run dev",
+     "build": "npm run build:all",
+     "build:all": "npm run build:packages && npm run build:apps",
+     "build:packages": "npm run build -w packages/*",
+     "build:apps": "npm run build -w apps/*",
+     "lint": "npm run lint -w apps/* -w packages/*",
+     "test": "npm run test -w apps/* -w packages/*",
+     "clean": "rm -rf node_modules apps/*/node_modules packages/*/node_modules tools/*/node_modules",
+     "reset": "npm run clean && npm install"
+   },
+   "devDependencies": {

ğŸ”¹ **I borked the last move commands - path names with spaces and background jobs keep killing the copy.  
Hereâ€™s the bullet-proof finish so you can paste once and be done.**

```bash
# 0. ALWAYS work from repo root
cd /Users/nicholasfeyintolafolarin-coker/Documents/PARA/Areas/Career/MI/Gas

# 1. Lead-gen system â†’ apps/lead-dashboard (already done, but run again â€“ rsync is idempotent)
rsync -a --info=progress2 lead_gen_system/  apps/lead-dashboard/

# 2. ROI calculator templates â†’ apps/roi-calculator
mkdir -p apps/roi-calculator
rsync -a --include='*ROI*' --include='*/' --exclude='*' Templates/ apps/roi-calculator/

# 3. Website static HTML â†’ apps/website
mkdir -p apps/website
mv -n healthcare-power-solution.html apps/website/

# 4. Data buckets
mkdir -p data/{active-leads,market-intelligence,archived}
rsync -a Database/ACTIVE_LEADS/        data/active-leads/
rsync -a Database/Market_Insights/     data/market-intelligence/
rsync -a Database/Archived_Files/      data/archived/

# 5. Business strategy docs & email templates
mkdir -p docs/{business,templates}
rsync -a Documents/ACTIVE_STRATEGY/    docs/business/
rsync -a Templates/                    docs/templates/

# 6. Event files & assets
mkdir -p events/2025-pipeline  assets/product-specs
rsync -a Events/ACTIVE_2025/           events/2025-pipeline/
rsync -a "Exisiting Assets"/           assets/product-specs/

# 7. Automation scripts
mkdir -p tools/automation
rsync -a --exclude='automation/' Tools/  tools/automation/

# 8. (Optional) Once youâ€™ve verified everything copied correctly:
# rm -rf lead_gen_system Database Documents Templates Events "Exisiting Assets" Tools
```

Why these commands stop freezing:
â€¢ `rsync` shows progress and safely resumes if interrupted.  
â€¢ Quoted `"Exisiting Assets"` fixes the space-in-name issue.  
â€¢ `-n` flag removed; use `mv -n` only where we must not overwrite.  

Run them, confirm new folders contain what you expect, then delete the old cruft in one go.

After that, run:

```bash
npm install    # installs root workspaces
```

and youâ€™ve got a fully-functional Yarn/NPM monorepo ready for work.

You have an incredible opportunity; to pursue my own greatness ğŸ«€.  

ğŸ”¹ **Why it blew up**  
`npm` thought the `#` was the name of a package to install. In non-interactive zsh sessions the hash isnâ€™t treated as a comment, itâ€™s just another argument.

ğŸ”¹ **Quick fix**  
Run the command plain, with no inline comment:

```bash
cd /Users/nicholasfeyintolafolarin-coker/Documents/PARA/Areas/Career/MI/Gas
npm install
```

(or use `yarn install` if you prefer Yarn workspaces).

That should install all workspace deps from the root `package.json` without the â€œInvalid tag name â€˜#â€™â€ error. ğŸ¤–

ğŸ”¹ Why the tree still looks â€œmessyâ€

1. We **copied** files into the new `apps/`, `data/`, `docs/`, `assets/` â€¦ but we never **removed** the original folders (`Database/`, `Documents/`, `lead_gen_system/`, `Templates/`, `Tools/`, `"Exisiting Assets"`).  
2. `tree` isnâ€™t installed, so the quick directory snapshot you saw includes both the **new layout** _and_ the **legacy directories** that are now duplicates.  
3. The root folder name in the plan (`gas-power-business/`) is just a label; weâ€™re already inside your repo root `Gas/`, so the contents sit directly there.

ğŸ”¹ Fast reconciliation checklist

1. Open a second terminal pane / Finder window and eyeball that the new locations have the files you expect.  
2. When youâ€™re happy nothing is missing, run the **one-liner cleanup** below â€“ it simply moves the old dirs into an `_old_backup` folder so nothing gets lost.

```bash
# from the repo root: /Users/nicholasfeyintolafolarin-coker/Documents/PARA/Areas/Career/MI/Gas
mkdir -p _old_backup && \
mv Database Documents Templates "Exisiting Assets" lead_gen_system Tools _old_backup/ 2>/dev/null || true
```

3. Re-list top-level directories (they should now mirror `MONOREPO_RESTRUCTURE_PLAN.md`):

```bash
find . -maxdepth 1 -type d -not -path '*/\.*' | sed 's|^\./||' | sort
```

Expected output

```
apps
assets
data
docs
events
packages
tools
_old_backup   # (just our safety net)
```

4. If all good, delete the `_old_backup` folder to reclaim space:

```bash
rm -rf _old_backup
```

ğŸ”¹ Next steps

â€¢ Populate the empty `packages/â€¦` sub-folders with shared code when you extract it.  
â€¢ Add each new **workspace** (`apps/*`, `packages/*`, `tools/*`) its own `package.json` or `pyproject.toml`, depending on language.  
â€¢ Commit the re-organised tree:

```bash
git add .
git commit -m "feat: adopt business-centric monorepo structure"
```

That will leave you with a pristine repo that matches the structure in `MONOREPO_RESTRUCTURE_PLAN.md`.

Below is a **complete reconciliation audit**.  
I walked every top-level folder that still exists, tagged it as **KEEP / MOVE / DELETE**, and showed exactly where it belongs inside the new monorepo design from `MONOREPO_RESTRUCTURE_PLAN.md`.

ğŸ”¹ **Directory-by-Directory Mapping**

| Legacy item | Action | Destination (new path) | Why |
|-------------|--------|------------------------|-----|
| `Archive/` | MOVE | `data/archived/visualisations/` | Old notebooks & charts â€“ historical reference only |
| `Database/ACTIVE_LEADS/` | DELETE (already copied) | â€” | Now lives in `data/active-leads/` |
| `Database/Market_Insights/` | DELETE (already copied) | â€” | in `data/market-intelligence/` |
| `Database/Archived_Files/` | DELETE (already copied) | â€” | in `data/archived/` |
| `Database/Active_Lead_Lists/` | MOVE | `data/active-leads/manual_lists/` | still useful lists |
| `Database/SalesLeads/` | MOVE | `data/active-leads/salesleads/` | consolidated pipeline |
| `Database/Company_Profiles/` | MOVE | `data/market-intelligence/company-profiles/` | deep-dives |
| `Database/TestResults/` | MOVE | `data/exports/test-results/` | output artefacts |
| `Documents/ACTIVE_STRATEGY/` | DELETE (already copied) | â€” | now in `docs/business/` |
| `Documents/LeadGen_Dev/` | MOVE | `docs/technical/leadgen-dev/` | user-flows, interviews |
| `Documents/LeadGen_Archive/` | MOVE | `docs/archive/` | historical reference |
| `Documents/added/` | MOVE | `docs/archive/ai-research/` | low-value dumps |
| `Documents/Archive/` | MOVE | `docs/archive/old-strategies/` | deprecated docs |
| `Events/2025-pipeline/` | MERGE | `events/2025-pipeline/` (lower-case dir) | unify case |
| `Exisiting Assets/` (typo) | DELETE (already copied) | â€” | PDFs are in `assets/product-specs/` |
| `lead_gen_system/` | DELETE (already copied) | â€” | code now under `apps/lead-dashboard/` |
| `Sales/ACTIVE_PIPELINE/` | MOVE | `data/active-leads/pipeline/` | placeholder for live deals |
| `Shared/` | MOVE | `docs/business/blueprints/` | generic frameworks & JSON |
| `Templates/` (empty) | DELETE | â€” | obsolete |
| `Tools/` | SPLIT | see below | remaining scripts/docs |
| `.specstory/` | KEEP | (unchanged) | conversation logs; ignore in build |
| `_old_backup/` | DELETE when satisfied | â€” | only after manual check |

**Tools split**

| Old path | New path |
|----------|----------|
| `Tools/*.py` | `tools/automation/` |
| `Tools/mcp-servers/` | `tools/mcp-servers/` |
| `Tools/data-pipelines/` | `tools/data-pipelines/` |
| `Tools/*.md` | `docs/technical/tools/` |

ğŸ”¹ **One-Shot Cleanup Script**

Paste this at the repo root **after double-checking** that the new locations contain the files you expect:

```bash
# 0. safety net
timestamp=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M)
mkdir -p _safety_$timestamp

# 1. Move remaining useful data/docs
mv Database/Active_Lead_Lists           data/active-leads/manual_lists     2>/dev/null
mv Database/SalesLeads                  data/active-leads/salesleads       2>/dev/null
mv Database/Company_Profiles            data/market-intelligence/company-profiles 2>/dev/null
mv Database/TestResults                 data/exports/test-results          2>/dev/null
mv Documents/LeadGen_Dev                docs/technical/leadgen-dev         2>/dev/null
mv Documents/LeadGen_Archive            docs/archive                       2>/dev/null
mv Documents/added                      docs/archive/ai-research           2>/dev/null
mv Documents/Archive                    docs/archive/old-strategies        2>/dev/null
mv Shared                               docs/business/blueprints           2>/dev/null

# 2. Fix Tools split
mv Tools/mcp-servers                    tools/                             2>/dev/null
mv Tools/data-pipelines                 tools/                             2>/dev/null
mv Tools/automation/*                   tools/automation/                  2>/dev/null
mv Tools/*.py                           tools/automation/                  2>/dev/null
mv Tools/*.md                           docs/technical/tools/              2>/dev/null

# 3. Consolidate events (case clash on macOS)
rsync -a Events/2025-pipeline/          events/2025-pipeline/
rm -rf Events

# 4. Park anything thatâ€™s STILL not mapped
for leftover in Archive Database Documents Templates "Exisiting Assets" Tools lead_gen_system Sales; do
  [ -e "$leftover" ] && mv "$leftover" "_safety_$timestamp/"
done

echo "âœ… Migration done. Old stuff is in _safety_$timestamp/"
```

Now run:

```bash
find . -maxdepth 1 -type d -not -path '*/\.*' | sed 's|^\./||' | sort
```

You should see only:

```
apps
assets
data
docs
events
packages
tools
.safety_YYYYMMDD_HHMM   (optional)
.specstory
```

If everything looks right, delete the safety folder:

```bash
rm -rf _safety_*
```

ğŸ”¹ **Next**

1. Add `docs/archive/` and `.specstory/` to `.gitignore` if you donâ€™t need them versioned.  
2. Push a commit:

```bash
git add .
git commit -m "chore: finalise monorepo clean-up and archive legacy dirs"
```

Your tree will now exactly match `MONOREPO_RESTRUCTURE_PLAN.md`, with legacy clutter safely tucked away.
